Well, I tried that now. It is not the kind of documentation I meant.

Such =
tools just twist and twirl data and present it in a way which does not help=
 much to understand the design.

A good documentation cannot be automated a=
way or roundtripped.

You need some text and some diagrams. Both need not b=
e perfect. But as I said, that can't be automated, or at least is not valua=
ble for understanding it quickly as it would be from a human who knows how =
man thinks and how the design is and what does matter to know and what is u=
nnecessary detail.

But it seems no matter what I would write, you mean tha=
t there will be no such manual documentation. A little design documentation=
 would be very good for understanding such a widely used tool. Thousands of=
 programmers should not need to download a specific tool and then discover =
that it does not help them understanding JUnit's design.

Just my opinion.
=
